Reviews.Title: “Babbi, Martin and the rest of the incompetent staff owe us a FREE stay in the room that we booked and should have gotten to stay”
Reviews.Author: Snobuny08
Reviews.Content: NIGHTMARE does not even begin to describe our experience! BABBI "The Manager" and her incompetent so called staff need lessons on hospitality and customer service! My boyfriend called the Haven and gave the month and dates of when we would be coming. He was referred to their website by front desk employee, Martin. He told my boyfriend that there were 4 rooms available and that online offered a discount. So my boyfriend tried booking online. Online said there were no availabilities for our dates. My boyfriend then called the Haven a SECOND time and Martin told him that the website probably has not updated yet and to keep checking throughout the day. I then called the Haven and spoke to Martin and I told him when we wanted to book (3rd time Martin was given our dates in 1 day) and if he could honor the online discount. He said he couldnt honor it. I asked how often the website is updated. Martin told me it is updated daily, usually early morning. So why would he tell my boyfriend to waste his time and check throughout the day? I told my boyfriend this and he decided to wait until the next day to check and see if it had updated. The next day, the site had not updated. My boyfriend called Haven for the 4th time and spoke to Martin again. He told Martin the site still said no rooms available and questioned Martin as to why he could not honor the online pricing. Martin then said he could honor the online price and we booked the weekend we had talked to Martin about over the course of 2 days and 4 phone calls. My boyfriend paid for 1 of the 2 nights upfront over the phone. When we arrived at the Haven on the days we booked, we spoke to Babbi and another front desk employee. They could not find our reservation. It turned out Martin booked us for a completely different month and completely different dates. Instead of being apologetic, the front desk employee said it wasn't his mistake and that he would never make a mistake like this. Babbi did not even apologize to us. We wanted a specific room and view and they put us in the opposite of what we wanted. They said the room they were putting us in was bigger but bigger isn't better when your view is of a brick building. We asked what would happen the following night since we booked 2 nights. Babbi said she would call other hotels and find us a room because they were totally booked. We stressed out all night and into the next day over where we were moving to. The next day we didn't get a phone call so we had to go to the front desk and get an update. Babbi said she hadn't found us a room yet. It seemed like she had yet to even look. She began making phone calls and then asked us again for our contact info to call us when she found something. This impacted our vacation because we couldnt go do what we wanted. We had to stay close to the hotel since we would have to come back and  switch hotels and were being told we needed to be out by 1:15. We finally got a call from Babbi saying she found 2 places. We had never heard of either. They were both in the higher number streets and we specifically wanted a hotel on the boardwalk with an ocean view. We asked her questions about the 2 different hotels and which best fit what we were looking for. She told us we would hate the Atlantic Oceanfront Inn and to go with the Thunderbird Beach Motel. She said the thunderbird was right along the end of the boardwalk so we could still go on it conveniently. She said she use to work at the Atlantic and its "really bad" and that we would "love" the Thunderbird "a lot." She said we would need to pay the Thunderbird a partial amount and she would cover the rest. We had to check out by 1:15 so we went back to our room and found the door was open. We told the guy cleaning on our floor that our door was open and he said, "nothing is going to happen, I'm up here working." Thats not the point however. You don't leave a door open for anyone to just walk in. We left the Haven still with no apology. The only thing we got was Babbi complaining about how her employee said "he didn't make a mistake" and that "he needs to own up to his mistakes." We couldn't even check in to the Thunderbird till 3pm so we had to figure out how to kill time and waste more of our vacation. Once we got to the Thunderbird and saw the condition, we wouldn't have even paid a penny to stay at this location! We called Babbi immediately and she refused to pay the total amount and said she "did not have any more petty cash to use." The hotel was NOT on the boardwalk like she told us. It wasn't even along the beach. The hotel was VERY dirty! There was old food left in the fridge. All our towels had huge brown stains on them. Our bathtub hadn't been cleaned and had hair in it. I felt disgusting and not relaxed there at all with all the noise coming from all the neighbors. We deserved much better treatment then this! We deserve compensation!!! I want them to give us a comped stay in the room we paid for!! We were treated beyond poorly. This was no vacation! These people need a lesson on customer service. Believe me when I say that Frank, the owner of this hotel will be hearing about this. No guest should ever be treated this way!

Reviews.Title: “If you like service, this isn't the place for you.”
Reviews.Author: blkbam
Reviews.Content: Juat like the others say, the parking is not on site. It is only 1 block away not 2 as others proclaim. OCMD doesn't have huge city blocks so it isn't that far but is cumbersome if you have a lot of stuff. The front desk staff are not on the same page when it comes to service. Each person you deal with will yield a different experience but will be equally helpful. I think they need to set a service policy in place to stay consistant. The rooms are huge and very clean! It was more room than I was expecting. The kitchenette was a bonus though I was not expecting it so I didn't use it. The main drawback of this place is the slow elevator serving the floors. It is slow and there is only 1 of them. You are encouraged not to use the stairs so they are not an option but should be since the facility is only 5 floors counting the ground level. The elevator makes this a place not to stay with the kids. The location is great, right on the boardwalk. If you get a room on the side you will not be bothered by the noise yet still have an ocean view.

Reviews.Title: “Parking. Checking in.”
Reviews.Author: Jen N
Reviews.Content: The Haven Hotel was okay. But the parking is horrible. You'll have to park a block away in order for your car not to get towed. The front desk service was alright. I wouldn't recommend staying here. My family stayed on the 5th floor, in order to get ice you have to take the elevator to the second floor then back. There is no internet access. No swimming pool for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Travelingplans
Reviews.Content: Parking Parking Parking. They do not tell you about the parking on any of the information. Only 8 spaces available 2 are handicapped spaces are near the hotel office door. The other parking is two blocks away!Hopefully if you leave for a dinner trip down the strip you will be able to park when you return. Rooms were okay, hospital twin bed in room with a queen. Sheets not too clean looking and towels are small and thin. Barely enough towels left. TV was difficult to navigate and front desk was no help. I will never stay here again. The only plus was it was near the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Courthalecki6
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my trip to Ocean city, My family & I stayed at the Haven Hotel. Check In was okay, besides the fact that if you park in the parking spots on the side for 5 minutes to check in you'll get a ticket! The room we stayed in was a suite, they gave us 2 towels (keep in mind the room sleeps 6) and there were no sheets for the sofa bed. Other then that I can't complain, the Jaccuzi was nice & thats the only place that I've stayed at in OC with decent water pressure. And the room was very clean. I will deffantly go back.

Reviews.Title: “The Haven was well worth the money, the location and view was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: hyn663
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights, I saw bad reviews on a web site, so I was alittle worried! The Haven was in a GREAT location. We had clean towels, a decent bed! I am pretty particular about the cleanliness ( worked in the hotel industry) the only thing I saw not clean was way under the bed! We got a non smoking room but whomever was in before us must have smoked but that wouldn't keep me from staying there again! If they would offer free WiFi it would boost my rating! If I had to complain about something that would be it! Someone complained parking was a block away... I really didn't care I got FREE parking I wasn't driving daily, and if I would have been I would have know I had a parking spot when I got back! Staff was very friendly! We stayed on the 5th floor so noise was no issue for us! But face it everyone is on vacation so there will be noise, but we didn't experience any annoying noise! If I go to OC MD again, I would definitely consider staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “If only we had read the reviews of this page 1st.”
Reviews.Author: muleman7
Reviews.Content: we took our grandkids for what we expected to be a fun weekend, the 1st night we checked in saturday 7-9-11, my wife being diabetic went to get into our room to get some food for a low blood suger, only to find her card would not open the door, went to front desk, only to find employee would not get off phone to adress her problem until she screamed at him, he could not open room door, finally another maintenance man came and said do you want it fixed tonight, da. so they had to install a new door handle lock assembly. spoke to mngr next morning said we would like to check out and we would be glad to pay for the 1st night. she would not refund 2nd night, so it is now in dispute with my credit card co. my wife and I both left itching from some type of bugs, beds so dirty had to sleep in clothes, floors sticky, terrible time, also met other guests in elevator that said thier tub wouldnt drain and they had to change thier room. beware of this motel, unless you want to take home unwanted guests...

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel to stay at with a young family!”
Reviews.Author: KRepine
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our hotel room, it was very clean and had a beautiful view of the boardwalk. I liked the size of the room, it was much larger than most hotel rooms. The kitchen area was nice, and included a coffee pot. The beds were a little stiff, but at least there weren't any bed bugs! Had a great time at ocean city, would recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great VAlue!”
Reviews.Author: ggsmiley123
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Haven Hotel was magnificent! Check-in, check-out was very fast and easy. The price was great but the views were even better! The rooms were also clean and spacious. One down to the hotel is the parking, but it was manageable. The hotel didn't have that many amenities but with its location right on the boardwalk, in the midst of everything, it didn't even matter. At night we had no problem sleeping for the beds were comfortable and the doors blocked out all the noise on from outside! Staff was also very friendly and accommodating. We loved the trip and will defiantly be returning next year!

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: neets88
Reviews.Content: The Haven Hotel has been around for quite awhile, however, it was refurbished in 2003. The location is wonderful...right on the boardwalk...close to the amusements. We had a fourth floor oceanfront room with a balcony that overlooked a magnificent beach. It amazed me that once the slider was closed we heard no noise from the boardwalk. The room was clean, the check-in and check-out was effortless, and the hotel staff were very pleasant and accommodating. There are only 6 parking spaces within steps of the lobby and the remaining parking is 2 streets away. We never had to move our car to go anywhere. Everything is right there! This is our second visit to the Haven Hotel and it won't be our last! We wished we had booked more nights so that we could have seen the fireworks from our balcony! Maybe next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great location...Great price”
Reviews.Author: TKLT27
Reviews.Content: Will be heading there for 5th straight year in a few days...The location is awesome right on the boardwalk in the center of everything and you won't find a better price in OC on the boards. Our rooms have always been clean and the staff has been fine...Yes most of the parking is a block away and there is no pool. But really if that is the most I have to complain about I am pretty happy.

Reviews.Title: “Six Year Anniversary Trashed.”
Reviews.Author: EddieOCMD2010
Reviews.Content: Being the "easy to please" type I didn't expect much for Ocean City in the Spring. Our six year anniversary was the weekend of April 23rd to April 25th 2010. I decided to spring a bit further forward for the occasion than your typical Quality Inn. Prior to visiting The Haven, I became excited with the room, and quickly booked it. Low and behold, I decided to put in a bit of research. I am not the type of person who thrives from complaining nor do I want to deter you. All I can share about my experience is the truth. What began as a romantic getaway quickly became a major frustration. After driving down to Ocean City, Maryland from Baltimore the driver can become a bit tired. We went to the office to collect our room key, because as stated, we reserved our room. My girlfriend and I are both twenty-one years old, and very mature for our age. We drive down to Ocean City, Maryland and without being told prior, ARE CHARGED $100.00 per person under the age of twenty-five? Let's be serious. When I checked out, I literally had to rely on the credibility of the hotel's room service to get my money back. This was not on the website, nor was it told. Had I not arrived with enough money would I have gotten a refund? Well that's just peanuts to begin with. After receiving some of the worst customer service I have ever seen, I proceeded to carrying my things to my room. Now, the website does explain that the complex has limited parking; there are literally no more than six parking spots beneath the building, all of which seemed to have been taken by the hotel's staff. There IS a parking lot two blocks away at Melvin's Steak House. The parking lot is dirty, trashy, and unguarded and the hotel assumes no responsibility for the vehicles in it. The parking lot is difficult to find at first because the OFFICE staff is not helpful at all. At minimum, they should be required to say "parking next to Melvin's". They sat at their desk watching TV with their foreign accents ignorant to the world while I paid their wages. My car's bumper was smashed ridiculously in the middle of the night. I didn't hear it because the parking lot was so far away. Nobody seen or heard anything, so now I'm stuck with paying an extra $200.00 because some drunk moron decided to back into my vehicle. After having to pay the room's fee, the $100.00 per person security deposit, and the $200.00 deductible for the hit and run I suffer, I would have been much better off going to a Quality Inn. The hotel offered no amenities besides a coffee pot with what seemed to be Arabian coffee. Enough to make you vomit. The ice buckets were dirty, there was hair in the shower, the water pressure was terrible. Hot water was limited. There were trash mouthed teenagers on the boardwalk benches out front of our hotel all night long drinking and starting trouble. The room service hardly services your room, and when they do the items they dispense are limited. I waited twenty-four hours for two towels. Now, I'm not sure about most of you but it'd be nice to have towels for BOTH the shower, and the jacuzzi. We had to use the same towel and purchase our own from Sunsations. They literally told me "we are out of hand towels" at a hotel. There was candy stuck on one of the blankets from the previous visitors. There were four flat sheets on my bed and not a single fitted sheet. The balcony was disgusting and they are not private at all. If you have neighbors, expect to have to whisper. My neighbor must have been picking crabs before I came down, because I went out in the middle of the night to smoke and there were shells blown all over my balcony. Disgusting people. Aside from the view, I wouldn't let my dog sleep in this hotel. Until the hotel manager gets his head straight, I will do my best to make sure nobody I know stays at The Haven. This hotel is nowhere near modern, everything on their website is false advertisement, and I personally would rather sleep on the beach than stay another night in The Haven. If the hotel manager is reading this and has any means to make this right. Feel free to contact me. [---] For those of you reading this review looking for a nice place to stay for the weekend I would strong advise The Spinnaker. I frequent Ocean City and visit almost every three weeks. =D I like to try out new places, but if ever dissatisfied I go back there. The room is stocked with a full kitchen, beautiful side view of the ocean almost unflawed, great access to a lot of nearby restaurants and activities, and most of all FRIENDLY AND HELPFUL SERVICE.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT THE HAVEN”
Reviews.Author: hollyBaltimoreCity
Reviews.Content: One word, "DIRTY!" The whole place was sticky and musty and we were afraid to take our shoes off. God invented the Holiday Inn for a reason, we checked out of this dump immediately and ran ourselves to a better hotel. My husband, who normally isn't too picky, was most disturbed to not find liners for the dirty ice buckets. I guess everyone has their breaking point. TIP: Go somewhere else. The location was great, but overall not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay again at the Haven.”
Reviews.Author: sweethoneysugah
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel is horrible. I paid a down payment on the room and received a letter in the mail stating what was left to pay when I arrived; however, the front desk still argued that I owed more and made me pay more. I had to pay a security deposit until my mother came the following day and was told I would get it back as soon as she came, that information was wrong. They would not let me get it until I checked out. The room was not even equipped with a hair dryer, alarm clock, etc., and was very dirty. There was a clothes rack but no clothes hangers and when we received an attitude when they were requested. We requested an extra blanket and they said it was not possible. I booked the room for four people and there was only two towels in our room. I requested to be provided with at least four towels the rest of my stay and couldn't even get that. When I checked out, I became aware that we were being accused of stealing towels when we never had enough to begin with. A roommate of ours lost his key card to get into the room and the lady at the front desk would not give him another one so he could get in or even call us (since we were sleeping and didn't hear him knock) to make sure he was with us. The same lady saw him check in with us. I have never experienced this type of service from any hotel before and I will never stay here again and would not recommend it to anybody. Best recommendation I have on the boardwalk at a great place is Paradise Plaza on 9th Street. I was actually on a business trip looking for hotels for my business to work deals with to provide them to our customers, because I am a travel agent, and it is sad to say but I am glad none of our customers will have to experience this hotel. Check out my booking site at [--]

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, Not Great”
Reviews.Author: Beachbob
Reviews.Content: Decided at the last minute to make a trip back to Ocean City for a long Labor Day weekend. Since our usual and favorite hotel was booked, the seach was on for a new place to stay. After several phone calls, I was quoted a price for an Ocean Front room at the Haven Hotel which was lower than any Ocean View room I could find. $430.00 for Thursday, Friday, and Saturday night of Labor Day. Arrived about 2:30 PM on Thursday and the room was ready. Upon entering the very small (OF Efficiency) room we found the room to be reasonably clean, however the carpet was not vacuumed very well. A call to the front desk and housekeeping showed up right away to vacuum. Over the 3 nights at Haven, we found the room to be comfortable, quiet for being right on the Boardwalk, great location, but few amenities other than a small refridgerator. No microwave, coffee maker, or alarm clock. The only problems we had were spotty housekeeping as the carpet was again not regularly vacuumed, and the bed sheets could stand to be replaced, as you could see the bleached out stains in them. Overall, I would rate the Haven Hotel as average or very slightly above. The location is great, it is reasonably quiet, and a good value for the price. I just can't get past the housekeeping, as I am spoiled by the fantastic housekeeping at Park Place. I would stay here again for a short stay. but for a week long vacation I would probably seek a better option.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: calebo12
Reviews.Content: The Haven Hotel has an excellent location (Oceanfront and 1st street right on the boardwalk) . It was a very nice, small and clean hotel. It was affordable (definitely for Ocean City) and the front desk people are nice. I had an Oceanfront jacuzzi efficiency room in which the beds were comfortable, the room was almost spotless, and the jacuzzi was fantastic. My only complaint is that the room lacked an alarm clock and a guide for places to go in Ocean City. And also, the parking wasn't bad and if the spots at the hotel are taken, there is plenty of parking offered 2 blocks down the street from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraM43
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in the hotel in March.We had ocean front room. The room was very nice and we had exceptional room service every day. After reading previous posts I was very surprised because front desk people were very nice and helpful at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaPa
Reviews.Content: I loved the place. Rooms were very clean, staff was very helpful and friendly and location exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: bigblueVirginia
Reviews.Content: The hotel was not clean. The staff, with the exeption of the cleaning staff, were extremely unfriendly, including the manager. There were cigarette buts on every balcony. There were no amenities within the hotel itself. The only good thing is the location of the hotel is that it is on the Boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “rude front desk person”
Reviews.Author: thumpher
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Haven Hotel for 3 days and the day front desk woman was very rude with no personality. Other than that it was an okay stay.

Reviews.Title: “My Stay”
Reviews.Author: Putnaml
Reviews.Content: I am 25 yrs old and have been staying at this exact hotel (even before it was torn down and rebuilt) in the semi-same room on the same floor off and on for almost 20 yrs. It's a decent price with decent staff (most of the time) w/ a fantastic location. We did have 1 problem about 7 yrs ago where the janitor was following us (the teenagers at the time) for being too loud on the balcony and walked right into our room via the side balcony door that was accessible from the hallway. My mother (deceased now) was relaxing on the bed in a nightie (was probably around 10 or 11 pm). The owner received an earful from my father you could expect and we never had another problem. It's always been a family tradition and this past Aug was the 1st time the "children" planned and booked and went without our father. Only complaint I have about most recent trip was that I was suppose to have a jacuzzi, I paid for one but didnt get one. All in all I will continue to stay at this hotel every year that I vacation in Ocean City

Reviews.Title: “We made the best choice!”
Reviews.Author: LynGrace2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from The Haven Hotel in Ocean City, Maryland in Aug 2007. We booked a Oceanfront Jacuzzi room. The room was a little outdated but very clean. Very pleasant maid service! The Hotel is situated in a perfect spot for all the attractions! Parking spots are very, very limited and had to park one block away in additional hotel parking. I was a little upset having to park away from the premises. But felt car was safe in the additional parking area. Over all we had a great stay at The Haven Hotel! After looking at many other hotels that we could of stayed at, we made the best choice! I would recommend the hotel to family and friends! When we return on our next vacation to Ocean City Maryland, we will definitely be staying again at.....The Haven Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: rojaji
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience, and found the staff to be really nice! I don't understand the complaints from other reviewers, but the managaer was very attentive. Parking is scarce all over this city, so that isn't really an issue of complaint for me. I was able to park fine, had no car parking issues. Room was clean, but could have been a bit more modern for my liking. But hey, the price was right, location was great...I'd stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Haven Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jotay
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week stay at the Haven Hotel and I must say this is a wonderful place. No it doesn't have a pool or a big lobby to hang out in but who needs that at the beach. We had an oceanfront effcy and it was awesome. The room was huge and beds comfortable. It was clean and the housekeeping was on the rooms early so by the time you got back from breakfast or the beach your room was cleaned. The kitchen area had a small fridge which kept things really cold, the a/c was super good, it also had a microwave and a large coffeemaker, sink and some cabinets. Everything we needed. The staff was very friendly and helpful. It is located on 1st street and the boards so it is right in the middle of everything, but yet at night when you closed your balconey door you couldn't hear a thing. The soundproofing in the hotel is unreal good. I never heard the boards or even another soul in that hotel the whole week we where there. I had read other reviews complaining about the parking situation and all I can say is I guess you can't please some folks. They have about 8 spots and 2 handicaps under the hotel which out of the 6 days we where there we found open about 4 of those days and the extra parking is on 1st and Philly right next to Melvins Steakhouse. It is a very short 2 blk walk. We had a great stay and we will be booking again there next year.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel 2-17 to 2-19-2006,,,were very pleased. we needed late check in and had no problem with that. when we arrived staff was very pleasant.. we got to our room, which was very nice.the hotel and staff were all we expected and we would gladly reccomend and stay there again..

Reviews.Title: “never again at the Haven”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We wanted to be as far down the boardwalk as possible to fish at the inlet so the Haven was thought to be a great place. Wrong! We were treated rudely from the beginning and even other visitors there complained to us on the elevator to our rooms about the attitude problem. The accomondations were really lacking and the service was terrible. The jucuzzi was dirty and no extra towels to use with it. There was no pool attendent and the pool was in a separate building across the parking lot. Also you had to park your car quite a way from the hotel. We will never go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service and disgusting bathroom”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First off, the employee working up front was beyond rude. Secondly, as we arrived in the hotel, everything looked good until we walked into the bathroom. There was urine all over the toilet, soap scum in the bathtub, open bottles of shampoo, and hair in the jacuzzi. It was absolutely disgusting that we ended up cleaning what we could while we were there. Also, there was no alarm clock, hairdryer, or iron. It is a great location, right on the boardwalk, but it's sad that no one takes care of the place. I definetly do not reccomend this place whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “The room looks nice BUT”
Reviews.Author: elmjr
Reviews.Content: When you walk into your room it looks very nice and clean but don't look under the bed. I did to make sure we left nothing behind. The things under there were not ours. Parking stinks once we found their unguarded parking lot we had to run back to the hotel in the pouring rain with children. The management is a little rude. We used the jacuzzi and got a call from them saying that the ceiling was leaking. It was only half full.So why pay for a jacuzzi and not be able to use it with out getting a call? Oh and if you want clean towels you have to throw the dirty ones on the floor but the location is good.

HotelInfo.Name: Haven Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 101 North 1st Street, Ocean City, MD 21842
